required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Confirming A Human Challenge Model and Investigating The Safety Of VLA1701
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Double-Blinded Pilot Study Confirming A Human Challenge Model Using LSN03-016011/A Expressing LT And CS17 And Investigating The Safety Of VLA1701 (An Investigational Oral Cholera And ETEC Vaccine)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, double-blind, placebo-controlled, Phase II vaccination and challenge study designed to confirm a human challenge model with E. coli strain LSN03-016011/A.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a single-center, double-blind, placebo-controlled, Phase II vaccination and challenge study designed to confirm a human challenge model with E. coli strain LSN03-016011/A (LT+, ST-, CS17), as well as collect expanded safety and immunogenicity data.
The study will be carried out in two phases:
Vaccination phase: up to 34 subjects will be randomized 1:1 to receive 2 doses of either VLA1701 or placebo orally. The doses will be given 7 days apart and subjects will be followed as an outpatient for safety.
Challenge Phase: 30 Subjects, out of the 34 subjects, will be challenged.
After challenge, subjects will be monitored for diarrhea and other signs/symptoms of enteric illness by daily medical checks, vital sign determinations, grading and weighing of all stools.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with severe to moderate diarrhea
primary_outcome.description: within 120 hours of challenge with ETEC strain LSN03-016011/A.

secondary_outcome.measure: Calculation of disease severity score after challenge with ETEC strain LSN03-016011/ A
secondary_outcome.description: ETEC diarrhea disease severity score with a score ranging from 0 (no disease) to 8 (most severe disease) utilizing objective signs, subjective Symptoms and stool Output. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4777366/table/pone.0149358.t005/

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with solicited adverse events
Percentage of subjects with any adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to Visit 4 (day of challenge, 23 days post first vaccination)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to Visit 4 (day of challenge, 23 days post first vaccination)

secondary_outcome.measure: percentage of subjects with any IMP related adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to Visit 4 (day of challenge, 23 days post first vaccination)

secondary_outcome.measure: percentage of subjects with IMP-related serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to Visit 4 (day of challenge, 23 days post first vaccination)

arm_group.description: VLA1701 is an investigational oral vaccine against LT-ETEC (Labile Toxin-Enterotoxigenic E coli) The vaccine is administered orally in 2 doses about 1 week apart.
The buffer component of VLA1701 will be used as Placebo. The vaccine is administered orally in 2 doses about 1 week apart.

intervention.description: VLA1701 is an investigational oral vaccine against LT-ETEC (Labile Toxin-Enterotoxigenic E coli)

facility.name: Department of International Health Johns Hopkins University
